name: John Doe
title: Complex Spinal Fusion Case Study
description: A successful case of complex spinal fusion surgery for severe degenerative disc disease.
fullDescription:
This case study presents the successful treatment of a 45-year-old patient with severe degenerative disc disease who underwent complex spinal fusion surgery. The patient had been suffering from chronic back pain for over 5 years and had tried various conservative treatments without success.

## Patient History

The patient, a 45-year-old office worker, presented with:
- Severe lower back pain radiating to both legs
- Difficulty walking and standing for extended periods
- Failed conservative treatments including physical therapy and medications
- MRI showing severe degenerative disc disease at L4-L5 and L5-S1 levels

## Treatment Plan

After thorough evaluation, Dr. Ankur Goswami recommended a two-level spinal fusion procedure using:
- Minimally invasive techniques
- Advanced instrumentation
- Bone graft material for fusion
- Post-operative rehabilitation program

## Surgical Procedure

The surgery was performed using:
- Small incisions (less than 2 inches each)
- Advanced imaging guidance
- Specialized surgical instruments
- Minimally invasive approach to preserve muscle tissue

## Results

Post-surgery results:
- Significant reduction in pain (90% improvement)
- Improved mobility and function
- Return to work within 8 weeks
- No complications during or after surgery
- Successful fusion confirmed on follow-up imaging

## Follow-up

The patient continues to do well with:
- Regular follow-up appointments
- Continued physical therapy
- Gradual return to normal activities
- Excellent long-term outcomes
